revised_title: Chemical Composition of Aleurone-Grains in Peony, Castor Oil Plant, and Blue Lupin
tldr: The author investigates the chemical composition of aleurone-grains in the peony, castor oil plant, and blue lupin. They find that the grains consist of a water-soluble proteid (hemialbumose) and another proteid that is insoluble in distilled water but soluble in 10% sodium acetate solution. The findings suggest that these grains have varying degrees of complexity in their composition.
